\[ \frac{1}{p} = a + 9d, \quad \frac{1}{q} = a + 99d, \quad \frac{1}{r} = a + 999d \]

The given system of linear equations is

From the third equation, dividing by $pqr$, we get
\[ \frac{x}{p} + \frac{y}{q} + \frac{z}{r} = 0 \]
Substituting $\frac{1}{p} = a+9d$, $\frac{1}{q} = a+99d$, $\frac{1}{r} = a+999d$, we have
\[ x(a+9d) + y(a+99d) + z(a+999d) = 0 \]
\[ a(x+y+z) + d(9x+99y+999z) = 0 \]
Using the first equation $x+y+z=1$, we get
\[ a + d(9x+99y+999z) = 0 \]
\[ 9x+99y+999z = -\frac{a}{d} \]
The second equation is $10x+100y+1000z = 0$.
Subtracting the two equations, we get
\[ x+y+z = \frac{a}{d} \]
Since $x+y+z=1$, we have $\frac{a}{d} = 1$. Thus, $a=d$.
Then $\frac{1}{p} = 10d, \frac{1}{q} = 100d, \frac{1}{r} = 1000d$.
Therefore, $p = \frac{1}{10d}, q = \frac{1}{100d}, r = \frac{1}{1000d}$.
Then $\frac{p}{q} = \frac{1/10d}{1/100d} = 10$, $\frac{q}{r} = \frac{1/100d}{1/1000d} = 10$, $\frac{p}{r} = \frac{1/10d}{1/1000d} = 100$.

(I) If $\frac{q}{r} = 10$, then the system has infinitely many solutions.
The equations are $x+y+z=1$, $10x+100y+1000z=0$, and $qrx+pry+pqz=0$.
Since $\frac{q}{r} = 10$, we have $q = 10r$.
Since $\frac{p}{q} = 10$, we have $p = 10q = 100r$.
Then $qrx+pry+pqz = 10r^2x + 100r^2y + 1000r^2z = 0$, which is $10x+100y+1000z=0$.
So we have $x+y+z=1$ and $10x+100y+1000z=0$.
Let $z=t$. Then $x+y = 1-t$ and $10x+100y = -1000t$.
$10x+10y = 10-10t$, so $90y = -1000t-10+10t = -990t-10$.
$y = -\frac{990t+10}{90} = -\frac{99t+1}{9}$.
$x = 1-t+\frac{99t+1}{9} = \frac{9-9t+99t+1}{9} = \frac{10+90t}{9}$.
So there are infinitely many solutions.
If $t=0$, then $x=\frac{10}{9}, y=-\frac{1}{9}, z=0$.
So (I) $\rightarrow$ (Q)

(II) If $\frac{p}{r} \neq 100$, then the system has no solution.
Since $\frac{p}{r} = 100$, if $\frac{p}{r} \neq 100$, then the system has no solution.
So (II) $\rightarrow$ (S)

(III) If $\frac{p}{q} \neq 10$, then the system has no solution.
Since $\frac{p}{q} = 10$, if $\frac{p}{q} \neq 10$, then the system has no solution.
So (III) $\rightarrow$ (S)

(IV) If $\frac{p}{q} = 10$, then the system has infinitely many solutions.
Since $\frac{p}{q} = 10$, we have $p = 10q$.
Then $qrx+pry+pqz = qrx+10qry+pqz = 0$.
$rx+10ry+qz = 0$.
$x+10y+\frac{q}{r}z = 0$.
Since $\frac{q}{r} = 10$, we have $x+10y+10z = 0$.
We have $x+y+z=1$ and $10x+100y+1000z=0$.
So (IV) $\rightarrow$ (R)
